subject: Productivity
title: Kahneman and Tversky's Revolution
description: Learn Kahneman and Tversky's Revolution in one minute.

hook.text: Two Israeli psychologists walked together for hours, laughing and arguing. They changed economics forever.

buildup.text: Kahneman and Tversky spent decades mapping the systematic errors in human judgment.

discovery.text: Their prospect theory showed that people evaluate gains and losses differently â€” losses hurt more.

twist.text: Economists resisted for years. Rational actor theory was sacred. Data eventually won the argument.

climax.text: Kahneman won the Nobel Prize in 2002. Tversky had died six years earlier and couldn't share it.

punchline.text: Two friends rewrote how the world understands decisions.
